Name: Keen Up!
Description:
Clean up, keep up!

Look at all this mess! The toys are lying all over the playroom — who could ever tidy them all up? Here is a fun and joyful clean-up adventure for your family: flip the cards and try to be the first to spot the matching toys on them. "Keen Up!" is a game to boost your child’s focus and attention while enjoying quality time spent together.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rock Paper Scissors
Description:
A chess-like game on a 6x6 board with each player having three pieces of each of rock, paper, and scissors - the pieces showing the respective RPS throw. Rock can take scissors, which can take paper, which can take rock. On your turn you will either move a piece three squares in any orthogonal combination except going back and forth, or drop one of your three extra pieces on any square. You win by taking four points worth of pieces. Scissors are worth two points each, the other pieces are worth one point each.

—user summary

Name: Möbi Kids
Description:
Mobi Kids is the perfect introduction to numbers for your little ones. Players each select one set of number tiles. Each set contains the exact same numbers. Players connect their number tiles to form equations using the communal operation tiles (+,- and =). The first player to connect all their number tiles wins!

If your little one is like ours, and not quite able to make equations yet, don't worry ... Inside the whale, there is an activity booklet full of mini-games. These games help kids gain confidence with numbers by offering a step-by-step approach to equation building and subsequently Mobi Kids gameplay!

-from the publisher's website

Name: Bllöx
Description:
BLLÖX is an action-packed stacking race! Flip over a card and race to build what you see faster than the other players. Super-simple to learn and super-fast to play, BLLÖX is the perfect game for the whole family! There are 36 wacky and creative ways to play included!

The object of the game is for each player to build a stack of blocks that appears on a common card before the other players can. When a player has finished building the stack, they slap the card with their hand to show that they were first to complete.

The winner of the round is the first player to get 3 Stacky Pack cards. The winner of the game is the first player to win 3 rounds.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Ultimö
Description:
There are 15 dice. One is gold. The object of the game is to get the gold die. Take 1, 2 or 3 dice each turn. The catch? You can't take the gold die until the last play of the game! Sure, there are more rules, but you get the idea! Part luck, part brains, all fun!

(From the publisher's website)

Ultimö is basically a Nim game, and is solved and deterministic. Note that while this game uses dice, they are un-numbered and are not rolled, and as such Ultimö would not be considered a 'Dice' game.

Name: Verzwickte 12
Description:
Each player gets 12 numbered tokens and puts them randomly face down on the spaces of his color. Only spaces 7 and 12 are left free. Now all tokens are turned over and the game Begins.

Each turn the players move 1 of their tokens 1 space in any direction and try to get each token on the space with the corresponding number. The first player to reach that goal wins the game.

The players may use the black spaces, but not the colored spaces of their opponents.

—user summary

Name: Kintsugi: Student and Master
Description:
A 4 card expansion for Kintsugi that introduces a 4 player team version of the game.


Released in the February 2018 Board Game of the Month Club $10+ package.
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: Rage-o-Meter
Description:
Published by Hot Leaf House
Game Designed by Suz Li & Vii Yu
Game Art by Suz Li & Vii Yu

Story synopsis:
"GinGee Gang Gang! Let's hang! GinGee's RUN! MAN! RUN! Concert is today!"

Will these six friends be able to make it to their hangout while overcoming events that test their character? Or will they ultimately rage and cancel their plans? Can friendship be stronger than rage?

Rage-o-Meter Description:
Rage-o-Meter is a 3 to 6 players cooperative card game about anger management and the strength of friendship where the players win or lose together.

Objective:
Players are offered to choose from the six GinGee Gang Gang friends, each with their own quirks and ticks. The main objective is to make it to the bottom of the Event deck with everyone mostly intact. (The GinGee Gang Gang friends are here to have a good time at this concert after all)

Gameplay (In Brief):
After determining who amongst the players is the "Angry Friend", it is their responsibility to keep track of time/rounds and the number of explosions. Once Meeting Time is decided amongst the group, and the Travel Time is set to be an hour prior (Travel Time is flexible depending on play group). Players are then assigned one of six GinGee Gang Gang friends to play as and collects the necessary items for their hand (ex: Character Board, Character ID card and stand, 3 Snack Tokens unless the player plays as Brie, they get 4 Snack tokens, and 3 Disruption Cards).

The goal of the game is to reach the bottom of the Event Deck without Travel Time catching to Meeting Time, and/or hitting 10 cumulative explosions.

Players have 3 actions where they:

     Draw an event then react accordingly (ex: Lose/Gain # of Rage, Gain a Snack Token, Add 5 minutes to Travel Time, etc.)
     Draw a Chat card, roll a dice, then apply effects to the group or individuals specified (ex: Lose/Gain # of Rage)
     A choice between eating 1 Snack (which helps diminish Rage) or Do Nothing


Teamwork, planning, looking out for one another, and a little bit of luck will help reaching the bottom of the Event deck with everyone mostly intact. Players should try their best to prevent themselves and each other from raging and exploding!

—description from the publisher

Name: Population Boom! or Doom?: Sects of the Old World
Description:
Players play as a faction of the Old World in a not-historically accurate Mediterranean.  Each player takes turns gaining population (score) or recruitment value which increases the amount of population a player will gain at a later time as well.

Players draw cards from the top of a deck or play a card that has been discarded with three draw and discard piles to choose from (Recruitment, Espionage, or Diplomacy)  At certain intervals a Boom or Doom will be drawn and a player rolls dice dictating which territories are impacted with a benefit or drawback for players located on those territories.

Additionally, events are played as well, with a maximum of two events in play that change some aspects of game play.

Once each player has taken five turns in the Age(round), the Age ends.  The game is played over three Ages.

—description from the designer

Name: Dojo: le duel des maîtres
Description:
In a world where everybody is born with elemental powers, the Dojos have been created so that Masters can teach their Prodigies how to live in harmony with their powers. Over time, rivalries between Dojos have appeared, and now is the time to determine who, of you or your opponent, is the greatest Dojo Master.

Dojo: le duel des maîtres is a card game, hand management and bluff game in which players will have to build and oppose their Prodigies teams to determine who is the greatest Dojo Master.

To win, you will have to use your resources to make your Prodigy win as much elemental Paths as possible among the 4 available. At the end of the 4 rounds of a game, the players with the most remaining Life Points will be declared the greatest Dojo Master.

—description from the designer

Name: The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game – The Mines of Moria
Description: Featuring 78 cards, The Mines of Moria invites you to enter this massive underground realm and create a custom-built The Lord of the Rings: The Card Game scenario filled with Spiders, Goblins, and other perilous encounters of your choice. As you play, you’ll come across many familiar cards with new and unexpected abilities, creating a unique new experience.
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: The Lord of the Rings – The Card Game (LCG)

Name: Heroes of Stalingrad: Battleground Set #5 – The Sewers
Description:
The Heroes of Stalingrad Kickstarter campaign was the opportunity to release an expansion to get you fighting in the sewers. It's now also available for Shadows over Normandie and Heroes of Normandie players.

This new environment presents a challenge and opens new, fun and original opportunities to fight on two levels (on the surface and in the sewers) or exclusively in the queasy depths of these underground tunnels.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Nottingham 2084
Description:
Nottingham, year 2084. Nott. Corps. controls the resources of the land, under the oppressing hand of K1NG-J0HN. In this time of despair, only a small group of humans, The Merry People, and their fierce leader Robin, stand their ground to face the robotic oppressors.

Nottingham 2084 is an asymmetrical game where two teams face each other to pick and deliver resources. On one side there is Robin and the Merry People (M.P.), collecting resources for humanity, and on the other, the Nottingham Corps.’s (N.C.) robots who want to control the resources to enslave humanity.

Each faction has unique powers and skills that you can use during the game, as well as different ways of collecting and saving the resources they gather. The Merry People will take the fuel from the robot’s towers and their HQ’s, while the robots will sack the villages and cities, stealing from the people. Then, the M.P will deliver those resources to the people in the cities, while the N.C will store them at to their own Headquarters. At the end of the game, the team with more resources collected will be the winners of the game.

Will you help Robin and the Merry People save Humanity? Or will you guide K1NG-J0HN’s robots on their path to human slavery?

—description from the publisher

Name: Shadows over Normandie: Cthulhu Mythos Call #4
Description:
You asked for it during the original Shadows over Normandie Kickstarter campaign and you sure had a lot of patience. But here they are, finally! Emerging from the sewers, from the heart of their lair, the ghouls are now joining the Mythos faction.

Cthulhu Mythos Call #4 introduces some creative gameplay because all ghouls have the Burrower special ability. Thanks to this special ability, Ghouls may move underground, approaching their preys as close as possible, before engaging in a close combat assault, their greatest feature.

However, don’t wait too long to get the ghouls to the surface or you’ll risk getting caught, and face the consequences… Although they’re heavily specialized troops – with only one life point – the ghouls are rather fragile.

The Ghoul Clan is lead by a ghoul priest with the disrupting habit, even for necrophagous ghouls, to play with food. This character benefits from the Master of the Dead special ability, supporting his clan’s powers by raising Zombies.

In closing, these punchboards contain a set of thematic options to reinforce your ghouls as well as different terrain elements filling out the elements in Battleground Set #5 - The Sewers.

This product is accompanied by a digital booklet, downloadable from our site, containing the rules to play with The Ghoul Clan as well as two scenarios.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Heroes System Tactical Scale World War 2

Name: Magic Flow
Description:
In Magic Flow, each player assumes the role of a rapper and needs monsters at the base of the rhyme.

Using the alternate turn, each time you can kill a monster, but care for who you have, another can attack your turn and get a pen to it.

Name: Kardnarök
Description:
In Kardnarök you are a Norse queen or a king who must fight with other kingdoms during the events of Ragnarok. Your kingdom summons heroes, builds armies of skilled warriors, performs strategic rituals, summons the blessings of the mighty gods, and can change your destiny to earn important victories!

Your kingdom must use the best armies, combining the runes and adding the forces of heroes and warriors, both in attack and defense. Then Jarls, Seiðkonas, Berserkir, Varies and Huskarls will fight alongside famous heroes like Ragnar, Lagertha, Siegfried, Björn, with the blessings of important gods and goddesses like Thor, Odin, Loki, Freya, Tyr!

After four rounds of intense combat, the kingdom that wins the most victory cards will be Midgard's leader under the illuminated protection of the risen god Balder!

The Kardnarök game is based on historical characters drawn from the Scandinavian poems about the "Viking era," with numerous sources of research in the Eddas, in the Neil Gaiman's acclaimed Northern Mythology and inspiration of the famous TV's series like Vikings and The Last Kingdom.

—description from the designer

Name: Jagged Alliance: The Board Game – Underground!
Description:
Adds the JA2 "SCI-Fi" Mode to the game, with a new dictator, the infamous Crepitus (8 new enemy minis), extra underground sectors and high-tech weaponry.
Fully compatible with Base Game Campaign

Name: Z-Shot
Description:
There are 12 zombies coming to eat your brain. Before that happens, use that brain – and the included 12 double-injection custom molded Bullet Dice – to either shoot a zombie now, or to strategically save that shot for later! Be the first player to shoot all 12 of your zombies.

info provided by publisher

Name: Munchkin Mighty Monsters
Description:
Munchkin Mighty Monsters is a fast-playing card game based in the world of Steve Jackson's best-selling Munchkin. You and your monster buddies are hanging out in the dungeon, just waiting to wallop some munchkins...but there are just too many of them! Play cards by matching either the rank or color of the last card played. Be careful – if you get stuck and can't play a card, bad stuff happens – the munchkins wallop you instead! Get walloped too often, and the munchkins defeat you. The first player who gets defeated three times loses the game, and everyone else wins!

Includes five Munchkin promo cards, because everyone needs more cards!

—description from the publisher

Name: NonSense Family
Description:
After the success of NonSense Classic, the game is back with a Family edition, illustrated for the youth. The rules are the same. A situation card known by every player sets the scene, a card "word" known only by the narrator who needs to slip this word casually into his story, and there it goes: the imagination takes care of the rest, but time is limited! The illustrations stimulate the kids imagination and help them project themselves into their story. The theme are inspired by their every day life: family, friends, school, food, animals... with mini-scenarios full of humor, signed par the illustrator Pierre Dalla Palma. Challenge, tension, chance, perspicacity, laughter… All is there to make really fun parties.

—description from the publisher

Name: NonSense Love
Description:
NonSense Love is the newest edition of the NonSense games, adapted for a more adult environment. It revolves around love relationships and saucy situations.
For example: "tired of cleaning the cat's litter box, you declare a sex strike".
The game also includes two-player scenarios like : "your colleague catches you pants down, sitting on the photocopier, you try to explain". You need to act or tell the story and try to casually slip in the narrative your secret word.
Ready? GO. You have one minute.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sing It Back Music Quiz
Description: Read out the lyrics from a well known song - your team mates must then guess the next line - singing is encouraged!  Earn extra points by guessing the artist and song titles.  This game includes 280 classic pop and rock hits from the 50s up to today's tunes.

Name: Tanto Cuore: Mimoza
Description:
Promo card originally released with various kickstarter campaigns.

She allows you to chambermaid one Chambermaid or Chambermaid chief from your hand to draw a card.

This is PR15.

Name: Too Many Bones: Splice & Dice
Description:
Prepare for work in the lab!

Too Many Bones: Splice & Dice allows players to create their own tyrants using baddies from their Too Many Bones base games and add-ons! Build a tyrant alongside your standard TMB games, or work for Nobulous outside of a TMB game and port your creation in later.

In addition to the brand new tyrant creation system, Splice & Dice brings new tyrants, encounters, and new dual baddie-type baddies into play - forcing players to invent new strategies and builds for their favorite characters.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tanto Cuore: Ariette Cuore
Description:
Promo card originally released with an art book. It was later given out as tournament prizes.

During your start phase you may discard one love card from your hand to gain a bonus:
1 Love => +1 Serving
2 Love => +3 Draw
3 Love => +5 Love

This is PR18.

Name: Tanto Cuore: Lapis Aurora
Description:
Promo card originally released with a calendar. It was later given out as tournament prizes. 
During your turn this maid allows you to change one maid that you play's Servings or Employments into Love or Draws.

This is PR38.

Name: Hooplastack
Description:
Swoop the hoop... but don't let the tower tumble!

Players stack a set of wooden shapes in a tower, lower a hoop down onto the table around the tower, then try to quickly "swoop the hoop" to pull out the lowest shape from the tower. If they succeed, they put the shape on top of the tower and pass the hoop to the next player. The player who knocks the tower over loses.

Name: Zenteeko
Description:
Zenteeko is a sneaky, super simple abstract strategy game for two or more players. The rules are easy – learn to play in under two minutes – but pay attention! The game is played on a 5 x 5 leather-like board and each player has four markers (we give you extra in case you lose one).

The object of the game is to get your four markers in one of four simple groupings: a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line, or in a square. Play begins with each player alternately placing a marker on the board. When all four markers are in place, players then take turns sliding their markers in any direction to achieve the objective. No jumping!

Things can change quickly; think ahead to your next move because your opponent may just slide into a winning position right under your nose! Games can last from 2 to 20 minutes depending on how crafty each player is.

Markers for three players fit into the round zippered pouch attached to the board.

This is a reboot of Teeko by John Scarne.

The entire board rolls up and snaps shut so you can take Zenteeko fun with you anywhere!

—description from the publisher

Name: Monster Decoy
Description:
Monster Decoy is a abstract strategy game with simple rules and black and white territory tiles design,available for 2 or 4 players.

As a member of Black/White Ghost Buster Team, you need to capture the monster all around the city.
Surround and capture the monster that you found in your territories, the team which get the higher points wins the game.

Players take on the role of a white and black Ghostbuster team to capture the ghosts that fill the city. Surround and capture the ghosts on your own territory, and the team with the most points in the end wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Cartomancer
Description: Two players simulate a magicians battle using the 78 cards of the tarot. Player summon a small army of arcana to battle opposing cards, while replenishing their cards fields from a shared pool of sephirot. Two players simulate a magicians battle using the 78 cards of the tarot. Player summon a small army of arcana to battle opposing cards, while replenishing their cards fields from a shared pool of sephirot.

Name: Saboteur: Veto
Description:
Saboteur: Veto is a single card expansion for Saboteur distributed during the 2019 Saboteur Championship. This card can be played with the base game of Saboteur and Saboteur: The Duel.

When playing the "Veto" card, you will cancel the card just played by an opponent.

Additional Clarification:


     You must play the “Veto” card during the turn of an opponent. This means after that player has played his card, but also before he/she draws a replacement card.
     When you play that card on the previous player, this means that you play twice a card in a row: once out of your turn and once in your turn.

Name: Samsara: Revelation Expansion
Description:
The Revelation expansion contains :

     7 additional characters (7 player boards - 7 standees - 7 markers - 7 game aids) The new characters are more aggressive and offer more interaction than original characters: it is strongly recommended not to play less than three players.
     16 special cards (8 Bhaga (luck) cards, 8 Durmangala (bad luck) cards
     10 Ancestral Amulets (Ancestral Amulets have the particularity to present on their red face an aggressive power, and on their silver face, an abundance power)
     1 rule leaflet FR / ENG


—description from the publisher

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Modern Horizons
Description: Modern Horizons contains 254 cards (5 snow-covered basic lands, 101 commons, 80 uncommons, 53 rares, 15 mythic rares), and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all these cards. In addition, there is a Buy-a-Box card numbered #255/254. This set introduced new cards into Modern without them ever being legal in Standard. It contains 209 new cards and (excepting the snow basics) only reprints which previously weren't legal in Modern. For this, it was rigorously playtested by Play Design. The Buy-a-Box card is also a new-to-Modern reprint. The powerful new card options, some with old mechanics, are mixed with flavorful updates for favorite characters. The snow-covered basic lands appear in the land slot of Modern Horizons boosters.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – War of the Spark
Description: War of the Spark is the 81st Magic expansion. It was released on May 3, 2019.Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three consecutive sets on the same world, unofficially referred to as the Guilds of Ravnica block.It covers the event of the same name.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Ravnica Allegiance
Description: Ravnica Allegiance is the 80th Magic expansion. It was released on January 25, 2019. Officially, it is not part of a block. However, it is part of a series of three that is set on the same world, unofficially called the Guilds of Ravnica block.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Dominaria
Description:
Dominaria is the 78th Magic expansion. It was released on April 27, 2018. It is not part of a block.
Dominaria is the first set to follow the Three-and-One Model, which abolished blocks. Richard Garfield is on the design team, for the first time since the original Innistrad set.It contains 269 cards (20 basic lands, 101 commons, 80 uncommons, 53 rares, 15 mythic rares), and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards.

Name: Magic: The Gathering – Rivals of Ixalan
Description:
Rivals of Ixalan is the 77th Magic expansion, and the second in the Ixalan block. It was released on January 19, 2018, and is a small expansion.

Rivals of Ixalan is the last regular small expansion to be released. The set contains 196 cards (5 basic lands, 70 common, 60 uncommon, 48 rare, and 13 mythic rare) and includes randomly inserted premium versions of all cards. Some of the rares are Double-faced cards which were printed on a separate print sheet. Nine additional cards are found in the set's planeswalker decks (2 mythic planeswalkers, 2 rares, 2 uncommons, 2 commons, and 1 common dual land).

Name: Bare Knuckle!
Description:
Bare-Knuckle! takes place in the rough and tumble era of English bare-knuckle boxing of the 1700’s. A time of the London prize ring rules when men of grit and brawn would throw their hat in the ring and fight round after round until one of them could not continue.

Bare-Knuckle! recreates a single round exhibition match. Two pugilists will enter the ring and take turns playing punches, grapples and other moves using cards and dice - all in an attempt to knock your opponent to the ground. The first boxer to knock their opponent down wins the match!

—description from the designer

Name: Unstable Unicorns: Rainbow Sprinkles Expansion Pack
Description:
Rainbows & Sprinkes...

Never judge an expansion pack by it's name! The Rainbow Sprinkles Expansion Pack for Unstable Unicorns is guaranteed to kill. Use Rainbows, cupcakes and Baby Unicorns to kill your way to victory.

Please note: This edition has no tuck box. This expansion pack is from the initial Kickstarter.

Includes 27 cards.

—description from the publisher

Name: Promote Pluto
Description:
Promote Pluto is a cooperative & competitive deck building game. Your goal: To make Pluto a planet again. Each player competes for Prestige by discovering and claiming objects in space while building their deck with items such as rovers, space telescopes, landers, and orbiters. Claim Pluto's moons, Halley's Comet, asteroids, and even planets to earn Prestige with the scientific community.

The player with the most Prestige becomes head of the International Space Agency, promotes Pluto, and wins the game!

(That is, if you all don’t lose first!)

—description from the designer

Name: Agave
Description:
A 45-60 euro style game about making Mezcal (artisan variant of Tequila)
You and another four Haciendas compite to fulfill Mescal formulas for the different companies in the game.
By rolling and manipulate the dice using money or the special abilities in your crew, you will put in work the fine machinery inside your hacienda untill all the exclusive contracts are gone.

But there is a catch, if you use single dies, everyone harvest, if you use pair or three of four of the kind, only you will harvest.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Adendorf
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Aurich
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Borkum
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Gersthofen
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Leer
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Lindau
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Dice Throne Adventures
Description:
Exploration, gold, treasure, upgrades, minions, boss battles, and even a shopkeeper named Rosella? Welcome to the latest addition to the Dice Throne universe!

Dice Throne Adventures (DTA) is a cooperative expansion that allows up to 4 players to use the heroes you already own in a brand new way. Work together over a series of game nights to travel from the Crimson Sands all the way to the Mad King's throne room. Your heroes will gain permanent deck upgrades with each session, but don't become overconfident. The King hasn't lost a single battle in a thousand years and he's eager for a real challenge.

Requires season 1, season 2, or marvel characters to play.

Name: Tempus Quest: Episode 3 – Decision at Degna
Description:
An honest days work is well and good, but nothing pays quite like crime, and between the usual backbone of smugglers and petty crooks, and the destabilizing presence of the liberation at Degna Station, there is more than enough work here to pay for at least a metajumps worth of fuel.

Games in the Tempus series work similarly to roll and write games where players roll dice and use the results to fill in a sheet. In the Tempus System, instead of using dice, players will use the date and time to randomize setup and available actions.

—description from the designer

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Moers
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Schwäbisch Hall
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Fields of Arle: New Travel Destination – Simmersfeld
Description: Feuerland started a set of new travel destinations. You can get them in the towns printed on the travel destination.

Name: Antiquity of Mars: Chronicles of a Dying Planet
Description:
1,000,000,000 years ago…
Mars was a flourishing planet teaming with life and vast seas. As the magnetic field over Mars was weakened, radiation began to dry up the seas and solar winds caused the atmosphere to deplete. As the atmosphere depleted, the planet’s ability to maintain heat decreased as well. As the millennia passed and the natural resources began to run low, the dwindling civilizations of Mars were forced to follow the rapidly shrinking seas. 
There is just one natural water source left, and not enough of it for everyone. In an increasingly harsh environment, the few remaining races of Mars struggle for survival.

Overview
Players will each represent a leader of one of the six remaining races of ancient Mars. Their goal is to claim the only remaining fertile land as their own and preserve it for as long as possible. At the start of the game players can take one action in each of three categories (political, civil, and military). As the game progresses, players will expand their influence, allowing additional actions of each type. Players will use their actions to gather resources, build atmosphere factories to slow the depletion of oxygen, and train armies to fend off the other races. Each race is equipped with unique abilities allowing for various approaches to victory.

—description from the designer

Name: Tick Tock Time
Description:
A card game of clocks and time.

A game played with 48 clock cards in 15-minute intervals, and 12 TIME cards. The player who uses all their cards first wins.

A shedding game based on clocks.

Name: Trend Color
Description:
Manipulate fashion trends in Trend Color to come out on top!

In the game, you secretly start with two colors (out of eight), and you want those colors to end up trending or (alternatively) be rare and hard to find so that you can score the most points with them. At the start of the game, you'll set up a trend board with 1-8 different color tokens, with spaces for those colors being paired in lines. If you end up with five tokens on the board, for example, two of those colors will be paired, while the other three will be next to blank spaces; those three colors might be paired with something over the five rounds of the game.

At the start of a round, you fill up the shop card display so that it contains five cards; each card has room for 2-5 color tokens. On a turn, you draw a color token from the bag, then place it on one of the available shop cards. If you fill the final space, you claim the card, place 1-3 of these tokens on the trend board (placing an unrepresented color in a new row and matching other tokens that already have their color present), keeping the remaining tokens as your earnings, then exiting the round. If you're the first player out in a round, you score bonus points.

If you place the fifth token of a color on the trend board, you decide whether to remove all tokens of that color or keep them where they are. If you remove them, a player can add that color to the trend board again in the future, possibly in a different row.

Once all players have a shop card, the round ends, then you refill the shop card area (leaving the lone card there in place with any tokens on it) and begin a new round. After the fifth round, the game ends and players score points: Tokens of the two colors that appear in the longest line on the trend board are worth 3 points each; tokens of the two colors in the second-longest line are worth 2 points each, in the third-longest line 1 point each, and in the shortest line 0 points each. If a color isn't present on the trend board, those tokens are worth 2 points each. Tokens of the same color as your two secret color cards are worth twice as many points as they would be otherwise. Add points for your token earnings to any bonus points you received. Whoever has the highest score has dominated the trends and wins!

Name: Christmas Tree: The Decorating – Wild Ornament Card
Description: This card has a wild symbol for the ornament, and is all blue on one side and all red on the other.

Name: PegLeg: The Boardgame
Description:
PegLeg: The Boardgame is a defense game where you are trying to survive all the crab waves without any reaching the top of the beach.   To fend them off you fire your cannon with it ricocheting around to hopefully wipe out the attackers. You do this by drawing shot chips out of a bag.  These you can play in any order, controlling your bounces.  Once you are out of chips, you then start drawing a chip at a time from the bag, making your bounces unpredictable. Each turn you get to choose an upgrade to improve your chances.  A larger hand size to control your shot? Better shot chips? or Pegs to give your cannonballs powerful effects?  Each choice shapes your strategy.

—description from the designer

Name: Island Project
Description:
The last chance for humankind to survive! As the Earth's sea levels keep rising due to global warming, there are only few remaining habitable lands on the planet. The world's top scientists scramble to come up with a rescue plan but most have failed.

Until 2165, the Island Project is launched using a way to activate submarine volcanoes to erupt gently. The flowing lava meets the ocean, and cools and hardens into a new island. Although the project is effective, when a volcano erupts and detonates nearby, hidden volcanoes, it will endanger the ocean and mankind. The timing of eruptions is hard to predict, and the trigger effects are widespread.

In order to conserve the tribal community, you need wise strategies and resilience to lead your tribesmen to safe islands and plateaus! Lead your tribe from the Native Islands and search for Newly Formed Islands.

Island Project is a family, party game, for all ages. The theme and artwork of the game smartly gives a strong message to environmental awareness, and knowledge of how lands were form  base on science.

During the game, players try their best to lead their own tribes to safe islands and plateaus, on the other hand avoiding the other players to receive points from doing the same, maybe it's a good idea that trying to create volcanoes next to the other tribes...and get to the safe places on your own since the space on the islands are limited...

Name: Speed Beating
Description:
One day, Kuraki Mura returned home as usual, but fainted instantly after struck by a beam of light. Since then, he has paid much attention to the features of people, such as the length of hair, glasses, earrings, moles, and beards, and he's had reflex actions of beating someone on the head or dodging someone's attack.

In each round Speed Beating, one card is flipped over, and there are two features on each card. If you have the red feature, grab the hammer as soon as possible to attack! If you have the blue one, grab the pan to defend yourself! If the player with the red feature beats the players with the blue one on the head successfully, they receive 1 point. The first player who collects five points wins.

Name: NonSense VDM
Description:
The game NonSense VDM ("Vie de Merde" aka FML "F… my Life") it's:

     FML stories in situation: FML stories to tell while slipping in a mysterious word which often doesn't blend naturally in the narrative. For example: "A burst of laughter hits you during a meeting" but the narrator must use the word "sausage" without people noticing it doesn't belong in the story. If the other players find out, the narrator has lost.
     A game for all ages: everybody can play and improvise with real anecdotes or fictional stories.
     And as a bonus: a booklet with the most insane FMLs! Pick one, improvise around it, slip in a secret word and don't get caught!

Name: BattleTech: Shattered Fortress
Description:
Shattered Fortress is one of two sourcebooks/scenario books that details the last years of the Dark Age Era (From 3146 to 3150). The events which are covered is the invasion of the Republic of the Sphere's Fortress Walls into Prefecture X and highlights other major events occuring across the Inner Sphere. Included among its rules are other gaming enhancements allowing play in Total Warfare Game Rules, A Time of War RPG & Alpha Strike. Featured in the back of this book are mini-campaigns for various events during this Era using the Chaos Campaign Rules/Warchest Point System. In this book, it discuses the possible methods that made the Fortress Walls and HPG Blackout possible.

From the Publisher:

REPUBLIC IN FLAMES!

In 3146, the Republic of the Sphere hangs by a tenuous thread. The last fragments of Devlin Stone’s dream to shepherd humankind toward a more prosperous future hide behind the impenetrable defenses of Fortress Republic. As the interstellar communications blackout rages, the ambitious Great Houses vie for military dominance, and the bloodthirsty Clans strive to find a weakness in the Fortress’s armor on their path to conquering Terra and claiming the coveted title of ilClan. When the Wall comes down, will the Inner Sphere plunge even further into the abyss of interstellar war, or will this herald the dawning of a new age?

Shattered Fortress chronicles the twilight of BattleTech’s Dark Age, as nations are thrown into turmoil and predators circle the broken remnants of the Republic of the Sphere. This volume provides a year-by-year look at pivotal turning points in Inner Sphere, offers a peek behind the curtain of Fortress Republic, and reveals the fateful decisions that will ultimately decide the future of the Inner Sphere.

Name: BattleTech: Historical – Wars of the Republic Era
Description:
Historical: Wars of the Republic Era is Catalyst Game Labs' sourcebook outlining three conflicts that began in the late thirty-first century and spanned early half of what was known as Early Republic Era prior to the Gray Monday event in 3132. These includes the 2nd Combine-Dominion War (3098-3101), Victoria War (3103-3105), and Capellan Crusades (3111-3113).

The book goes into details of what began these conflicts, political leaders and their motivations, and actions taken by various military formations in these wars. Also included are game tools, special command abilities for regiments and important leaders during these wars and Random Assignment Table for two of the conflicts.

From the back cover    Edit

“    Local Disputes
In 3081, the Republic of the Sphere was born from the ruins of the Word of Blake Protectorate. For an Inner Sphere devastated by the horrors of escalating war, the Republic was a beacon of hope for a brighter, more peaceful future…For a time, it almost was.

Historical: Wars of the Republic Era describes the border conflicts that inevitably erupted in the decades after the Word of Blake Jihad. Covering the largest of these conflicts in particular—including the Second Combine-Dominion War, the Victoria War, and the Republic of the Sphere’s own war against the Capellan Confederation—this book provides a hard look at the early years of what would come to be known as the Dark Age Era.

Name: MacArthur's Defeat: The Battle For Luzon
Description:
MacArthur's defeat is a simulation of the Japanese invasion of the Philippines from December 1941 to May 1942. Designed for two player but easily played solo, the game covers land and air operations, abstracting naval operations.

Units are primarily regiments with some battalions. Artillery  battalions are represented in a semi-abstract manner. Air units are at group (for the Japanese) and squadron (United States and Commonwealth of the Philippines) level. Tank units can be massed together or broken down in company sized units and assigned to support infantry divisions.

Japanese surprise, B-17s, Bataan, Corregidor, and other key elements of the campaign are all included.

—description from the designer

Name: Rogue President Card Game
Description:
Time is running out to save America. A Rogue President has taken control of our nation, hell-bent on destroying Democracy while establishing a new political order built on greed, corruption, and deceit. You are a special agent determined to reveal his high crimes by pairing Rogue President Cards with corresponding Justice Served Cards. The first agent to lay down 12 pairs of cards helps compel Congress to impeach Rogue President and wins the game. However, if all 12 Crisis Cards are revealed before Rogue President is impeached, the game is over and America spirals into Civil War.

—description from the publisher

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome – Khorne Bloodbound
Description:
Chaos Battletome: Khorne Bloodbound is the  guide to fielding a Bloodbound army for Age of Sigmar.

This book contains a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans and warscrolls for fielding your Bloodbound army in games of Age of Sigmar.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome – Everchosen
Description:
Chaos Battletome: Everchosen is the  guide to fielding Archaon the Everchosen and his dark servants in Age of Sigmar.

This book contains the history and deeds of the chaos champion Archaon, as well as a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans and warscrolls for fielding Archaon, the Varanguard, and the Gaunt Summoner in games of Age of Sigmar.

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Order Battletome – Kharadron Overlords
Description:
Order Battletome: Kharadron Overlords is the guide to fielding a Kharadron Overlord army in Age of Sigmar.

This book contains the history and deeds of the Kharadron Overlords, as well as a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans, warscrolls and allegiance abilities for fielding the Kharadron Overlords in Age of Sigmar.

Name: Midway: Turning the Tide in the Pacific
Description:
This is a game on the Battle of Midway that took place on June 4, 1942. During the battle, the imperial Japanese Navy (IJN) lost four aircraft carriers at once, turning the tide of the war in the Pacific Theater. Yes, in the game, the player's decisions may alter history.
One player controls the US forces, while the other the IJN Kido Butai.

Solitaire rules are also included, in this case the player controls the IJN Kido Butai, with the game system controlling the US actions.

Name: Extra Credit Magic Knights
Description:
Extra Credit Magic Knights is a co-operative, medium-weight game in which each player takes on the role of a Magical Knight tasked with defending the city. Drawing inspiration from Mahou Shoujo and other anime, you get to take on the role of a teenager forced to balance school, living your normal life, and saving the world from destruction at the hands of the Dark Knights and their monstrous allies.

Each game you generate a character from an Ability and a Source of your power. You can then even coordinate with others to get a costume that synergizes to give you that extra edge in combat. Each of you needs to balance your Grades, Skill, and Fun, with bonuses for getting them high and terrible ramifications of them getting too low. You're going to need teamwork and friendship to have a chance!

Each week you start your plan of what you'll be doing, only for Events to arise partway through planning, potentially interrupting your plans. Manage your resources, plan for the unexpected, and prepare yourself to do battle against the dreaded enemies.

The Monsters, Events, Magical Girl Abilities and Sources, and the Dark Knights are randomized every time you play, allowing for countless possibilities!

—description from the publisher

Name: Insuropoly
Description: Reimplementation of Monopoly, featuring board game spots like Buffett Boulevard and Structured Settlements Street. Insuropoly was created to recognize employees of Berkshire Hathaway Homestate Companies and the National Indemnity Company and was used as gifts for employees. It was not sold in stores.

Name: プリウスレーシング (Prius Racing)
Dogs: O Sócio
Description:
Dogs: O Sócio ("The Partner") is an expansion for the game Dogs. In this expansion, the players' dog shelters are expanded by an influential partner who adds a dog hotel and other facilities. Three new dog races are introduced (pit bull, basset and chow chow), and a fifth player can join the game.

—user summary

Name: Retro Karts
Description:
Boost and blast your way into first place in this throwback to your favourite retro kart racing game.

How will you win the race?

Will you cuningly boost your way into fist pace or will you recklessly blast your opponents out of your way?

In Retro Karts, players must choose their cards quickly in a pick and pass card draft. The cards you choose determines who is fastest and who plays first. But first place isn't always the best as it means your the biggest target for other players.

After the card draft players will roll any power up dice they've managed to collect (slower players tend to get more power ups). You then choose how you want to use these dice: boost or blast...just try not to crash as if you roll too many crashes you will be out of luck!

—description from the designer

Name: Rustic Cuff Monopoly
Description:
This edition of Monopoly is centered around the popular, Oklahoma, jewelry line, Rustic Cuff.

Rustic Cuff was created in the summer of 2011 by Jill Donovan. Jill’s lifelong obsession with cuffs and a need for a creative outlet turned into so much more. With her days filled with young children and her evenings filled with teaching Law at the University of Tulsa, Jill began teaching herself all aspects of leather making and metal design in her guest bedroom in the middle of the night.Rustic Cuff has been featured on Good Morning America, ABC’s The View, The Wendy Williams Show, and E!News. RC has also gained favor with celebrities including, Giuliana Rancic, Miranda Lambert, Gayle King, Kathie Lee Gifford, Elisabeth Hasselbeck , and GMA’s Lara Spencer to name a few. The most popular sparkly bracelet is the Emerson style.

Name: Galactic Keep Solitaire Warrior
Description:
Visit the outer rim of a dark sci-fi world in Galactic Keep Solitaire Warrior, a quick, simple, solo card battling game.

Set out a grid of nine cards in three rows of three, flip a card to reveal your warrior. Overtake as many other cards as you can in attack-vs-health battles, or choose to attack your warrior with a face-down card to strategically gain the most points you can. Heal your warrior with the "Healing Nanobots" card (once) and watch out for plague cards which instantly kill your warrior, granting you no points. Clear the deck and rack up the highest score you can!

FUN FACT: In the GALACTIC KEEP UNIVERSE, the name of this popular battle solitaire game is commonly translated as "Death Rise" or "Death Toll" from the native Pakall name for the game, "Fher’Bek"!

The game is comprised of a 35-Card SOLITAIRE WARRIOR deck with 31 WARRIOR cards, 3 PLAGUE cards, and 1 FULL HEAL card (plus 1 RULE card). Also included in the game are 4 six-sided dice that can be used to track the remaining health of damaged warriors.

—description from the designer

Name: Vinyl: Masters of Metal
Description:
Get ready to turn it up and rock out! Masters of Metal is a stand-alone game in the Vinyl universe that headbangs with the hottest metal records, builds collections, and introduces memorabilia! In Masters of Metal, you’ll be collecting records, buying posters, and getting T-shirts of your favorite bands to add value to your library…but scoring schwag isn’t that simple!

To attach memorabilia, you’ll need to arrange merch icons so they are adjacent between albums. The more albums and memorabilia means a bigger collection and bigger points!

Name: 1825: Extension Kit G1 – Supplemental Money
Description:
1825 Extension Kit G1: Supplementary Money is an expansion for the 1825 family of games.  It contains paper money in the following denominations:

8 @ £25, 14 @ £200, 14 @ £500 (total value £10,000)

Ownership of at least one of 1825 Unit 1, 1825 Unit 2 or 1825 Unit 3 is required.

This expansion is most likely to be useful if you are playing a combination of one or more of the 1825 games listed above together with a selection of the 1825 expansions that add new companies and/or trains.  The optimal bank size is generally considered to be larger when you add more companies and trains, and Extension Kit G1 adds more bank notes that allow you to increase the size of the bank above what is provided for in the base game(s).

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Grand Alliance – Order
Description:
Grand Alliance - Order is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Order in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 156 warscrolls and 19 warscroll battalions allowing players to field armies both mortal and mystical drawn from the forces of Order, including;

- Stormcast Eternals
- Extremis Chambers
- Seraphon
- Sylvaneth
- Fyreslayers
- Devoted of Sigmar
- Free Peoples
- Collegiate Arcane
- Ironweld Arsenal
- Dispossessed
- Eldritch Council
- Phoenix Temple
- Lion Rangers
- Order Draconis
- Swifthawk Agents
- Scourge Privateers
- Daughters of Khaine
- Darkling Covens
- Shadowblades
- Order Serpentis
- Wanderers

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Grand Alliance – Death
Description:
Grand Alliance - Death is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Death in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 36 warscrolls allowing players to field the many deathless sevants of Nagash the Great Necromancer, including;


     Deathlords
     Soulblight
     Deathmages
     Deadwalkers
     Deathrattle
     Flesh-eater Courts
     Beasts of the Grave
     Nighthaunt

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Grand Alliance – Destruction
Description:
Grand Alliance - Destruction is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Destruction in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 61 warscrolls allowing players to field the countless agents of destruction that rampage across the Mortal Realms, including;


     Greenskinz
     Ironjawz
     Bonesplitterz
     Gitmob Grotz
     Moonclan Grotz
     Spiderfang Grotz
     Aleguzzler Gargants
     Troggoths
     Gutbusters
     Beastclaw Ogors
     Firebellies
     Maneaters

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Grand Alliance – Chaos
Description:
Grand Alliance - Chaos is a guide to the armies and factions devoted to Chaos in Warhammer Age of Sigmar.

This book contains 156 warscrolls and 11 warscroll battalions allowing players to field the many mortal and daemonic servants of the Dark Gods, including;


     Everchosen
     Slaves to Darkness
     Khorne Bloodbound
     Daemons of Khorne
     Tzeentch Arcanites
     Daemons of Tzeentch
     Nurgle Rotbringers
     Daemons of Nurgle
     Hosts of Slaanesh
     Daemons of Chaos
     Chaos Brayherds
     Chaos Warherds
     Monsters of Chaos
     Chaos Gargants
     Thunderscorn
     Skaven Masterclan
     Skaven Verminus
     Skaven Skryre
     Skaven Moulder
     Skaven Pestilens
     Skaven Eshin

Name: Thunderstone Quest: Frozen in Time
Description:
This is Quest #7 for Thunderstone Quest, first made available through the Thunderstone Quest: Back to the Dungeon Kickstarter campaign.

Frozen in Time, the seventh quest for Thunderstone Quest, can be used in any mode of Thunderstone Quest. This expansion includes more than 260 cards, six dungeon tiles, and a rulebook.

Name: 18MM
Description:
The design has a blank 7x7 map that is randomly covered by 49 tiles which have numbered cities or terrain on them. Players start with the same capital regardless of the number of players. The game adds extra trains and more private companies based on the number of players (similar to 1846). Train availability, tile
availability, and game end work on a fixed schedule, similar to 18CZ except the round also determines train/tile as well as when stock/operating rounds/end game occur.

For the first 3 rounds there is one city available per player to start a company in. It works a lot like the minor companies in 1822 where you can see that cities 4, 8, 12 are available in the first round (for a 3 player game), 1, 11, 20 are available in round 2, and 9, 14, 18 are available in round 3. The starting locations are auctioned by highest bid with the bid being discarded to the bank and then the player chooses the starting share price after winning the bid. Players can only start one company each in each of the first 3 rounds, so once you win a bid for a starting location you cannot compete in the other auctions this round. Thus the last player gets the final starting location for $0 without an auction. After the first 3 stock rounds, new companies can be started in any city with an open station circle (after winning the auction for the starting location) and players can start more than one company in a given stock round.

There is also one randomly picked private company available per player for the first 3 rounds. The private companies are auctioned and count as capital toward starting a company like in 1817. Unlike the starting city locations, players can win more than one bid for the private companies. Some of the private companies produce revenue each round (unlike 1817) so it sometimes make sense to hold a private company for a few rounds before using it to start a company.

The game has multiple train types each in limited supply. You can buy hex trains (which are good for running to multiple cities right by each other), freight trains (which pick up coal and can run to the off map areas), passenger trains (+10 revenue into the company per city), plus trains (get to run one extra time before rusting), or advanced trains (run the turn they are purchased). The price of the older trains drop each round (you can buy a 2 freight train for $120 in the first operating round, $90 in round 2, or $60 in round 3).

You have the 2/5/10 share system similar to 1817, including mergers. Companies can take loans similar to 1817 except the loan market is not shared, instead the loan interest rate is driven based on which operating round it is. You have the option when doing 5 share mergers to add share values together instead of averaging as in 1817 (receiving 3 shares instead of 6) to recapitalize a company.

President shares can be sold to the market and companies then liquidate at the end of the stock round if no other player buys the president share. Trains can only be purchased between companies for full price for a current phase train of 1/2 price for a non current train. The shorting features from 1817 were not included in 1888 for obvious reasons as well as to simply the game.

The game takes in the 4 to 5 hour range and is intended to be a fun & easy game to play. The goal is simply to maximize your net worth at the end by running trains for as much as possible, driving up their share price, and then dumping the companies right before their trains rust. Players can't go bankrupt because they can just dump companies in bad financial health and companies which cannot buy a train will just die (no presidential liability).

Name: Gem Blenders TCG
Description: Gem Blenders is a trading card game. Face off against your opponents in organizing a team of heroes that has the special ability to harness the energies within gems. Equip your team with different combinations of gems to use powerful transformations called blends. Position your heroes, use effects, and attack to hit your opponents for maximum damage.

Name: Ignite Cards
Description:
Ignite is a fast-paced game where you race to destroy opposing forges by commanding your minions to ignite, attack, and combo your way to victory!

As the Forgemaster, your task is to construct a powerful lineup to destroy the enemy's Forge. When your Forge takes damage, remove that many cards from the top of your Forge, placing them into your Scrapheap. Once an empty Forge takes damage, it's destroyed and that player loses the game.

Your Forge consists of 30 Minion cards, which behave like most monsters in games in the TCG/CCG genre: they have cost, attack, and health values, and can attack each other or a "life total" (an opposing forge). The playboard features a place for the players deck (Forge), destroyed minions (Scrapheap), Energy used to summon minions, and summoned minions (Lineup). The core mechanic of the game is Ignite: all Bot cards Ignite. When a Bot Ignites, players roll the two Ignite Dice (d6) to determine which target is hit and for how much. The Bot has Ignite Values, displayed on the bottom in three flames, which display how much damage is caused by the explosion.

There are two parts of the turn: Attacking and Building. During Attacking, players can attack with any number of their Minions against any opposing Minion or Forge. If there is a Forge Guardian (minion on slot 1), that Minion must be attacked and destroyed first. The second part of the turn is Building, where players can spend Energy to summon Minions, or draw cards. Players start their turns with 4 Energy, with the first turn of the game starting with only 2 (2 player only), and players start the game with 5 cards in their hands. Minions typically have one of two abilities: Summon or Scrap abilities, which occur when the minion is Summoned or Destroyed respectively. The deck is full of Bots which Ignite, and Forgelings, which can be combined with them to Ignite more often or power up Ignite abilities. For 3+ player games, player sit in a circle, play proceeds clockwise, you can only attack adjacent players, and Ignites hit both adjacent players! To start, simply place your shuffled Forge on your game board, along with 4 energy, then draw 5 cards.

For more you can find the website at https://ignite.cards/ and the rules at rules.ignite.cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Find the Bug! Project
Description:
You play an IT project manager responsible for a project team. You recruit and train project members, assign them to development and test tasks, and deliver against time, cost and quality budgets. The game can be used to teach project management but also works without its theme as an economic engine game.

Your tasks earn you victory points. The more you comply with the specific project budgets and priorities, the higher the multiplier. When a number of projects equal to the number of players have been delivered, the player with the most victory points wins.

The game board consists of a tableau of project cards and a tableau of steering group cards. The players take turns to perform one of the following tasks:


     Recruit: Take one project member card.
     Train: Flip one project member card to its senior face.
     Assign: Assign a project member to a project.
         The project member gets an ”achievement” depending on the contribution to the project (time, cost or quality).
        The project gets a ”budget post” (time or cost).
    
     Report status: Return all assigned project members. Then place a ”seat" between two steering group cards.


Once all seats around a steering group card are full, the player may call for a go/nogo meeting at a project. If approved, the project is scored and the player with achievements in it earn victory points depending on three factors:


     The quality of the project (the number of bug free tasks).
     The budget compliance (actuals vs budgets for time, cost and quality).
     The steering group priorities (multipliers for time, cost and quality).


The challenge of Find the Bug! - Project is to build a team that is best suited for the tasks while also manipulate the steering group priorities to earn the most victory points.

The unique mechanism of Find the Bug! - Project is the tight interaction between all players. They all operate on the same projects and steering groups where one player’s achievement may ruin another player’s budget, and where even the right achievement may be ignored by the wrong steering group.

—description from the designer

Name: Dyce
Description:
You play a whisky trader, who buys, blends and sells whisky. You do this by setting up shops in the Scottish city of Dyce and attracting buying and selling whisky barons there. You win by having earned the most pounds at the end of the game.

The whisky is represented by colored cubes. Pure whiskies (blue, red and yellow) can be bought for 1-3 pounds, mixed into blended whiskies (green, orange, purple, and black) and sold for 4-6 pounds. The whisky is sold and bought by whisky barons. Each whisky baron has a random line of dies, telling their preferred colors and prices.

The city of Dyce contains 5x5 spaces. Take turns to place up to two items in any empty spaces.


     An empty shop for the cost of 1 pound.
     A colored cube, telling what you want to buy/sell in your shop.
     A white cube for the cost of 1 pound, making your shop more attractive to the whisky barons.


 
When all players have passed, each whisky baron moves 1 space closer to the shop that buys or sells a preferred whisky (or, in case of a tie, the shop with the most white cubes). When a whisky baron reaches a shop, the owner buys or sells according to the current die value and the whisky baron draws and rolls a new die.

The game ends after six rounds, in which at least 1 blended whisky was sold.

The die lines simulates a random yet predictable market for the players to engage in. This adds both a time element and a spatial element to the game. Only the player who knows what, where and when to trade will blend the finest whisky of the Highlands.

—description from the designer

Name: Warring States
Description:
The fate of Ancient China is at stake as several dynasties struggle for supremacy. As a leader of a dynasty, you must position your forces at the right time at the right state to claim it for yourself.

The Ancient China consists of 12 states, each of them surrounded by six grid points where armies may be placed. Some grid points border several states, hence making their armies more powerful. You claim a state if you have the most armies at the end of a round. You win if you claim 3/4/5 states (5/4/3 players).

Each round you compete for a state You do so by playing cards representing either two tactics (light) or one tactics (dark). Each card also represents one strategy. One light card may be played each turn together with none or one dark card. Each card played must match either a tactics or a strategy of your previously played light card.

When you pass you take the battle field of all tactics and strategies where you have a majority. Tactical battle field cards let you place new armies while strategic cards let you manipulate already placed armies. Also, an early pass gives you an early pick of new cards from a drawing row. However, it makes the remaining battle field cards easier to get for the other players.
 
When the round ends, you claim the state if you have the most armies around it. Also, all previous states are reassessed to see if the majority has changed. (Remember that an army may reach more states.) One of the battle field cards allows you to decide the next state to battle for to take advantage of well positioned armies.

The mechanism of playing the right cards and placing the armies right creates a double majority game where you must manage both cards and board to get the upper hand. Also, the fact that armies may reach more states may turn tactical losses at one state to a strategic victory as other states are claimed instead.

—description from the designer

Name: So Long, My World: Defier of Fate
Description:
This is a Kickstarter exclusive expansion pack

"The only human being who, for reasons unknown, is free from the disruption of identity… While she is destined to die like everyone else, she is still attempting to save her world.

Her left eye is covered by a golden mask. It is said that the left eye has a connection to the Eye of the Sun, also known as Mark of Sol"

Each turn a new special type of Gestalt card, the Defier of Fate cards, is revealed during the End Phase. These special cards address where the Defier of Fate is moving and what bonuses she will give to the players that will cross her path. Maybe some will decide to keep following her, inspired by her everlasting hope, trying to save a world that can't be saved.

The new starting card, This World is Wrong must be taken at the start of the game and allows the players to negate the Defier of Fate effects to other players. Be careful when you choose to meet the Defier of Fate: players before you may want to have a grasp of her knowledge without letting you have the same. However, something will always await for the last player.

All the cards in this expansion are focused on either obtaining different outcomes from meeting and following the Defier of Fate, or ignoring her, maybe even opposing her!

The Defier of Fate expansion pack is compatible with Solo Mode:-

Many cards of the set are signed with an icon: those can be used in solo mode, and following a very few rules all solo games can be played having the Defier of Fate wandering for this dying world. Perhaps she may show the player a truth they didn't already see.

Name: Donguri Yama
Description:
In Donguri Yama (ã©ã‚“ãã‚Šã‚„ã¾, which means "Acorn Mountain" in English), players attempt to build an eight-level pyramid of cards.

Cards show numbers from 0 to 5, with the numbers showing in the upper left- and right-hand corners as well as in the middle of the bottom edge. The bottom row of the pyramid is eight cards wide, and players can place a card in the second row on top of two other cards as long as the sum or difference of the two supporting cards equals the card being placed. On top of an adjacent 1 and 3, for example, you can place either a 2 or a 4.

Since the deck contains cards from 0-5, an adjacent 4 and 5 can have only a 1 placed on top of them. Players need to keep these restrictions in mind as they work their way to the top of the pyramid. Can you reach the summit?

Name: Donguri Yama: Sixes and Eagle
Description: Donguri Yama: Sixes and Eagle is an expansion for Donguri Yama that consists of seven cards numbered 6 and an eagle that can be any number. Shuffle these cards into the deck for a new pyramid-building challenge!

Name: Reise durch Italien
Description:
Objective: Be the first traveling through Italy.
- moving by turns -
simple 'Roll & Move' game; ending on any space follow instructions.
as usual: pay money - get money back being 1st, 2nd, 3rd

notes:
very nice/cute pewter pawns - impressive drawings
likely published ~1900.
Similar game to "Reise durch die Schweiz nach den italienischen Seen".

—user summary

Name: Warhammer Age of Sigmar: Chaos Battletome – Disciples of Tzeentch
Description:
Chaos Battletome: Disciples of Tzeentch is the guide to fielding the mortal and daemonic servants of Tzeentch in Age of Sigmar.

This book contains the dark history and deeds of Tzeentch and his minions. It also includes a miniatures showcase illustrating colour schemes and painting advice, plus examples of painted models. It also features rules, battleplans, warscrolls and allegiance abilities for fielding the Disciples of Tzeentch in Age of Sigmar.

—description from the publisher

Name: FNG: Tour of Duty
Description:
In FNG: Tour of Duty you’ll step into the dusty, muddy boots of a Grunt, a Boonierat who slogs through jungle and rice paddies, and fights house to house in Hue City and scores of villages and towns across Vietnam. You will be Infantry, but you will encounter people of different Professions during your Tour of Duty that will serve as the focus of Missions, help or hurt you in your campaign – or just add to your story.

Because it’s all about the Story; your Story!

What: Wargame/RPG rules for the Vietnam War.

—description from the publisher

Name: Actium Naval Rules
Description:
Published as an article in issue #307 of Slingshot magazine, this is a fast-play set of miniatures rules for Roman and Hellenistic naval warfare.

Ships have numerical ratings for Crew (representing both numbers and skill), Hull (representing both size and quality), and Speed, plus yes/no options for whether they're capable of particularly tight turns and/or incendiary attacks. All further differences between ships are abstracted away, although the included scenario adds some back in with a special rule for non-combat grain transports.

Name: Fetch Quest: Heroes of Pugmire Booster
Description:
Fetch Quest is a cooperative deck-building game for 3-6 players of ages 12 and up. Playing time is approximately 60-90 minutes.

Heroes of Pugmire gives you ten new pioneers to use in your Fetch Quest games. Voltaire Vizsla and Oliver Quentin Beagle IV are both ready to take on the quest. Or, use one of the seven provided cat characters to give you games a feline twist!

—description from the publisher

Note: The detail of the description is accurate (two dog and seven cat cards) but the booster only contains nine playable cards. The tenth is a non-playable cover.

Name: Tres trenes
Description:
Two-player domino game (for a double-six set) in which players must, in each turn, add a piece into a common line of play in the centre of the table and a piece into a line of play of their own. Failure to do both steps in a turn means defeat. If all pieces are used up, the extremes of the lines of play are used to compute scores which will determine the winner.

Players start with a hand of seven pieces; in each turn they draw one piece and play out two, so that the number of available pieces for each turn shrinks during the game.

—description from the designer

Name: Dice Crash
Description:
Players stack dice chosen by one of them and score points when the tower holds... or lose points if it collapses. The difficulty depends of course on the size of the die, but especially on the order in which it is placed and the tower on which it is placed. And these two conditions are dictated to the player by the face value of his die.

The first player rolls the dice and chooses, following a few simple rules, which ones they will give to their opponents and to whom. The player who rolls first becomes the first player and, in turn, will try to score points and cause his opponents to fall by forcing them to try risky balances.

Name: King of Karts
Description:
It’s a race to the finish! As you and your friend's race, use items, dodge obstacles, and avoid crashing, in order to be the first to cross that checkered finish line and get the golden cup!

Players roll racing dice in order to move along the racetrack. Players also have a hand of maneuver cards that form the racing deck that will aid them in the race.

—description from the publisher

Name: Super Chess
Description:
Super Chess is a card-based expansion of traditional chess. 
It puts a twist on the way traditional chess is played by introducing 36 unique cards. When activated, these cards spice up the game in a variety of unpredictable ways.
Cards can remove pieces (removal cards), revive pieces (revival cards), alter the positions of pieces (spatial manipulation cards), or give the pieces new abilities (ability cards).
